title: Nainital
summary: Nainital (Kumaoni: Naintāl or Nainītālā; pronounced [nɛnːtaːl]) is a popular hill station of India. It is the judicial capital of Uttarakhand, the High Court of the state being located there, and is the headquarters of the Kumaon division as well as an eponymous district. It also houses the Governor of Uttarakhand,[4] who resides in the Raj Bhavan. Nainital was the summer capital[5] of the United Provinces.
